title: Cranberry Chutney
ingredients: 1 pound fresh, or frozen, cranberries, cooked
½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
instructions: Heat the jalapeño jelly with the vinegar, honey, and sugar in a saucepan.  Simmer until the sugar has dissolved, then add the cooked cranberries and mix thoroughly.  Add the raisins, garlic, cinnamon, allspice, ginger, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, and pecan and mix thoroughly.

If you intend to use the chutney immediately, let it sit for at least one hour to allow the flavors to meld.  However, the chutney can be made several days ahead and refrigerated then warmed to serve.
remarks: The chutney will keep at least 2 weeks in the refrigerator.  Also, if fresh or frozen cranberries are not available you can substitute 2 cans of whole cranberry sauce.
source: Chefs’ Secrets by Pat Mozersky, Food & Dining Section,  Express News.
